result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin L. Feltz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay fine of $100 plus costs including the Domestic Abuse and DNA surcharges.

No abusive contact with the victim, Ms. Kelley.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Write a letter of apology to the victim and provide to the agent to forward if appropriate. 
Attend, complete and pay for the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program.
Participate in any other counseling recommended by the agent.

timeConds.notes:
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date. 
(7 days credit applies to the conditional jail time).

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Benjamin L. Feltz in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State has complied with Victim Notificiation Statutes.  Files a Victim Impact Statement with the Court.  The victim is present in the courtroom and would like to make a statement. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 2 - NO CONTEST
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. 

Victim makes statements at this time.
Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Arendt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 2 - 
Serve 150 days jail.  STAYED
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months: 
Pay a fine of $100 plus costs including the domestic abuse surcharge and the DNA surcharge. 
Serve 30 days in jail. 
May serve with huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow.
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.
7 days credit to apply to the conditional jail time.
Maintain fulltime employment. 
No abusive contact with the victim, Ms. Kelley.
Write a letter of apology to the victim and provide to agent to forward if appropriate.
Attend, complete and pay for the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Participate in any other counseling recommended by the agent.
Plea hearing on October 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 8, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin L. Feltz in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:34 p.m. case is called.
Address is verified.
Appearances stated on the record.
Court has received written Waiver 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant/attorney received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered on all charges.  
Bond Continued
3:39 p.m. case is concluded.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 09:30 am.
